replies.msg: Despite making just 21 appearances, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has missed more big chances than any other player in Europe's top five leagues this season (22).

Liverpool have conceded 34 goals in 31 Premier League games, which is their best since 2011-12 when Kenny Dalglish’s side had let in 33 over the same number of matches. In Klopp’s first season it was 42 at this stage and last season 39, writes @_pauljoyce

Thomas Lemar has expressed his disappointment he didn't move to Liverpool in January – but hasn't given up hope of a move to Anfield. (@LivEchoLFC)

Lemar: “Regrets? Maybe. I’m not going to hide it, I was a little disappointed. Once it's over, it's over, so I try not to think about it.”

Lemar: “I’ve kept working so that these clubs come back during the next transfer window.”

Lemar: "I am open to all offers. I am a football player, I like football. I do not close any door."

replies.msg: Liverpool have no interest in RB Leipzig's Timo Werner with Jurgen Klopp not looking to sign a striker this summer, writes @JamesPearceEcho

Naby Keita will make the move to Anfield from Leipzig this summer but clubmate Werner won't be joining him. He is not on Klopp’s wishlist. (James Pearce)

Recruiting a centre-forward isn't on the agenda as Klopp is happy with the cover he's got for first choice No.9 Roberto Firmino. (James Pearce)

As it stands, Danny Ings, Dominic Solanke and Brewster will provide competition and back-up for Firmino. Sturridge is likely to be sold but a decision on Origi has not yet been taken. (James Pearce)

Paul Joyce of The Times has suggested that the club are going to focus on three positions - a goalkeeper, a holding midfielder, and a Coutinho replacement. replies.msg: Brewster will provide competition

Watford midfielder Abdoulaye Doucoure has made no secret of his desire to move to Liverpool, saying it would be a "dream" to make the switch to Anfield. (@LivEchoLFC)

Doucoure: “Liverpool is a club that needs no introduction. I was impatient to play there at Anfield, I wanted to feel the atmosphere.“

Doucoure: ”For me it would be a dream to play in a club like this.”

Doucoure: “If there is an offer, we will discuss to find the best solution. Everyone wants to play in the Champions League, the big competitions.”

replies.msg:
Simon Mignolet is prepared to stay and fight for his place at Anfield after losing the No 1 spot to Loris Karius.

Mignolet: “Always the only thing you try to do is prove every time in training you are ready for when the chance comes along.”

Mignolet: "It is never easy of course because I have never in my career spent time on the bench, but it is how it is and the only thing you can do is try to change it but it is never easy."

Mignolet: "That's the only thing I can do so I try to stay professional in training, try to work as hard as I can, show that I'm ready for whenever the chance happens.”

Clyne trained with the likes of Alberto Moreno, Dejan Lovren, James Milner, Loris Karius, Danny Ward, Danny Ings and Joel Matip. (Echo)

The full squad will be reunited on Wednesday - less than 72 hours before the lunchtime clash with Palace. (Echo)

Liverpool retain hope that Emre Can could feature against Crystal Palace on Saturday - but Joe Gomez will miss the Premier League trip to Selhurst Park, writes @JamesPearceEcho

Liverpool insist there’s no major concern over Can’s fitness and he will continue to receive treatment in the hope that he can train later in the week. (Echo)

The Reds say it’s too early to put a timescale on the Joe Gomez’s absence. They believe they will be able to make a better judgement when the swelling has gone down. (Echo)

However, the fear is that Gomez will miss both legs of Liverpool’s Champions League quarter-final tie with Manchester City. (Echo)
Dejan Lovren is ready to hand Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp a selection poser after returning to training. (@LivEchoLFC)

quote.msg:
Nathaniel Clyne stepped up his push for a first-team recall as a depleted Liverpool squad trained at Melwood on Monday, writes @JamesPearceEcho

Clyne is in contention for Saturday’s Premier League trip to Crystal Palace after Joe Gomez was hurt on international duty. (Echo)

Clyne trained with the likes of Alberto Moreno, Dejan Lovren, James Milner, Loris Karius, Danny Ward, Danny Ings and Joel Matip. (Echo)

The full squad will be reunited on Wednesday - less than 72 hours before the lunchtime clash with Palace. (Echo)
